source_sentence: ◎「爾時太子至年十歲，諸釋種中，五百童子，皆亦同年。
translation: â€œThen the prince reached the age of ten, and there were five hundred sons of the Śākya lineage who were all the same age.

source_sentence: 太子從弟提婆達多，次名難陀，次名孫陀羅難陀等；或有三十相、三十一相者，或復雖有三十二相，相不分明；各閑伎藝，有大筋力。
translation: Some of them had thirty or thirty-one marks, or even though they had thirty-two marks, their marks weren't clearly delineated; each was skilled in his own art and had great tendon strength.

source_sentence: 時提婆達多等五百童子，既聞太子諸藝皆通，名徹十方，共相謂言：『太子雖復聰明智慧，善解書論，至於力膂，詎勝我等！』
translation: When Devadatta and the other five hundred boys heard that the prince was skilled in all of these arts and was well-known throughout the ten directions, they all said to each other, 'Although the prince is intelligent and wise and well versed in writing and discourse, his strength is far superior to ours!'

source_sentence: 欲與太子較其勇健。
translation: He wanted to compare his bravery with that of the prince.

source_sentence: 爾時父王，又訪國中善知射者，而召之來，令教太子，即往後園，欲射鐵鼓；提婆達多等五百童子，亦悉隨從。
translation: It was then that the king, his father, summoned a man in his country who knew well how to shoot, summoned him, and told him to teach the prince.

source_sentence: 時師即便授一小弓而與太子，太子含笑而問之言：『以此與我，欲作何等？』
translation: The master then gave the prince a small bow, and the prince smilingly asked him, 'What do you want to give me this for?'

source_sentence: 射師答言：『欲令太子射此鐵鼓。』
translation: The archer replied, 'I want the prince to shoot this iron drum.'

source_sentence: 太子又言：『此弓力弱，更求如是七弓將來。』
translation: The prince then said, 'This bow is weak; ask for seven more like it for the future.'

source_sentence: 師即授與，太子便執七弓，以射一箭，過七鐵鼓。
translation: The master then gave them to him, and the prince then took the seven bows and shot one arrow past the seven iron drums.

source_sentence: 時彼射師，往白王言：『大王！
translation: The archer then went to the king and said, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 太子自知射藝，以一箭力，射過七鼓，閻浮提中無能等者。
translation: The prince himself knew the art of archery, and with the power of one arrow, he could shoot past seven drums; there's no equal in Jambudvīpa.

source_sentence: 云何令我為作師耶？』
translation: Why would you make me your teacher?'

source_sentence: 「爾時白淨王聞此語已，心大歡喜，而自念言：『我子聰明，書論算數四遠悉知；而其射藝四方人民，未有知者。』
translation: "When King Baishen heard this, his heart rejoiced greatly, and he thought to himself, 'My son is so clever that he knows everything about writing, discourse, arithmetic, and the four distances; but there's no one in the four directions who knows his marksmanship.'

source_sentence: 即勅太子及提婆達多等五百童子，又復擊鼓唱令國界：『太子薩婆悉達，却後七日當出後園，欲試武藝；諸人民中有勇力者，可悉來此。』
translation: He then commanded the prince, Devadatta, and 500 other boys to beat the drum again and call out to the country, 'The prince, Sapta Siddhârtha, will leave Houyuan seven days from now to test his martial arts; all the people who have courage may come here.'

source_sentence: 到第七日，提婆達多與六萬眷屬，最先出城。
translation: On the seventh day, Devadatta and 60,000 of his retinue were the first to leave the city.

source_sentence: 于時有一大象，當城門住，此諸軍眾，皆不敢前，提婆達多問諸人言：『何故住此而不前耶？』
translation: When a large elephant stood at the city gate, the troops didn't dare to come forward, and Devadatta asked them, 'Why are you standing here and not coming forward?'

source_sentence: 諸人答言：『有一大象，當門而立，舉眾畏之，故不敢前。』
translation: The people answered, 'There's a large elephant standing in front of the gate, and the people are too frightened to go there.'

source_sentence: 提婆達多聞此言已，獨前象所，以手搏頭，即便躃地；於是軍眾次第得過。
translation: After hearing this, Devadatta went up to the elephant alone, struck it on the head with his hand, and fell to the ground; the army then passed one by one.

source_sentence: 爾時難陀又與眷屬亦欲出城，其諸軍眾徐步漸前，難陀即問：『何故行遲？』
translation: It was then that Nandanavana and his retinue were about to leave the city, and as the army was gradually moving forward, Nandanavana asked, 'Why are you late?'

source_sentence: 諸人答言：『提婆達多手搏一象，躃在城門，妨行者路，以是故遲。』
translation: The people answered, 'Devadatta wrestled an elephant with his hand, and it fell at the city gate, obstructing the travelers' path; that's why it was late.'

source_sentence: 難陀即便前至象所，以足指挑象，擲著路傍；無數人眾，聚共看之。
translation: Even then, Nandanavana went to the elephant, picked it up with his finger, and threw it to the side of the road; countless people gathered to look at it.

source_sentence: 爾時太子與十萬眷屬，前後圍繞，始出城門，見於路傍人眾聚看即便問曰：『此諸人輩，為何所看？』
translation: The prince and his 100,000 followers surrounded him from front to back as he began to leave the city gates, and when they saw the crowd of people looking at him from the roadside, they asked, 'What are these people looking at?'

source_sentence: 從人答言：『提婆達多手搏一象，躃在城門，妨人行路；難陀次出，以足指挑擲著於此，是故行人悉聚看之。』
translation: The followers replied, 'Devadatta wrestled an elephant with his hand, fell down at the city gate, and obstructed the people's path; the next time Nandha emerged, he picked it up with his toes and threw it there, so the people gathered to look at it.'

source_sentence: 於是太子即自念言：『今者正是現力之時。』
translation: The prince then thought to himself, 'Now is the right time to show my strength.'

source_sentence: 太子便即以手執象，擲著城外，還以手接，不令傷損；象又還穌，無所苦痛。
translation: The prince then took the elephant in his hand, tossed it outside the city, and picked it up with his hand so it wouldn't get hurt; the elephant then came back to him, suffering no pain.

source_sentence: 時諸人民，歎未曾有。
translation: The people then praised him as being unprecedented.

source_sentence: 王聞此已，深生奇特。
translation: After the king heard this, he was deeply impressed.

source_sentence: 「如是太子及提婆達多并與難陀，四遠人民，皆悉來集，在彼園中。
translation: "Thus, the prince, Devadatta, Nandanavana, and the people from four distant lands all gathered there in the garden.

source_sentence: 爾時彼園，種種莊嚴，施列金鼓、銀鼓、鍮石之鼓、銅鐵等鼓，各有七枚。
translation: At the time, that park was decorated in various ways, with a display of seven gold drums, silver drums, copper-stone drums, and bronze and iron drums.

source_sentence: 爾時提婆達多，最先射之，徹三金鼓；次及難陀，亦徹三鼓；諸來人眾，悉皆雅歎。
translation: Devadatta was then the first to shoot them, firing three gold drums, followed by Nandanavana, who also fired three drums; the people who came were all in awe.

source_sentence: 爾時群臣，白太子言：『提婆達多及與難陀，皆已射訖，今者次第正在太子，唯願太子射此諸鼓。』
translation: The crowd of ministers then said to the prince, 'Devadatta and Nandanavana have finished shooting, so now we're going to ask the prince to shoot at these drums in order.'

source_sentence: 如是三請，太子曰：『善！』
translation: After these three requests, the prince said, 'Good!'

source_sentence: 而語之言：『若欲使我射諸鼓者，此弓力弱，更覓強者。』
translation: He said, 'If you want me to shoot at the drums, this bow is weak; find another strong one.'

source_sentence: 諸臣答言：『太子祖王有一良弓，今在王庫。』
translation: The ministers answered, 'The prince's ancestor has a good bow in the king's treasury.'

source_sentence: 太子語言：『便可取來。』
translation: The prince said, 'You can bring it here.'

source_sentence: 弓既至已，太子即牽以放一箭，徹過諸鼓，然後入池，泉水流出，又亦穿過大鐵圍山。
translation: When the bow arrived, the prince took it, fired an arrow that pierced through the drums, then plunged it into a pond where the water flowed out, and it also pierced through a great ring of iron mountains.

source_sentence: 「爾時提婆達多又與難陀，共相撲戲，二人力等，亦無勝者。
translation: "At the time, Devadatta and Nandanavana were playing at each other's throats, but they were equal in strength and had no match.

source_sentence: 太子又前，手執二弟，躃之於地，以慈力故不令傷痛。
translation: The prince then went forward, took his two brothers in his hand, and fell to the ground, not letting them be hurt by the power of his kindness.

source_sentence: 爾時四遠諸人民眾，既見太子有如此力，高聲唱言：『白淨王太子，非但智慧勝一切人，其力勇健亦無等者。』
translation: At the time, a multitude of people from four distant places saw that the prince had such strength and raised their voices, saying, 'Prince Baishenwang, not only is your wisdom superior to that of any person, but your strength and courage are unequalled.'

source_sentence: 莫不歎伏，益生恭敬。
translation: They all praised and subdued him, and they all became more respectful.

source_sentence: 「爾時白淨王，即會諸臣而共議言：『太子今者年已長大，智慧勇健，皆悉具足，今宜應以四大海水灌太子頂。』
translation: "It was then that King Baekjeong gathered his ministers together and said, 'Now that the prince has grown old and has all of his wisdom and strength, it would be appropriate to pour the four great waters of the ocean over his head.'

source_sentence: 又復勅下餘小國王：『却後二月八日，灌太子頂，皆可來集。』
translation: Again, he commanded the other small kingdoms, 'Yet on the eighth day of the second month, they will pour water over the crown prince's head, and all may come and gather.'

source_sentence: 至二月八日，諸餘國王并及仙人婆羅門等，皆悉雲集。
translation: On the eighth day of the second month, the kings of the other states and the sages and brāhmaṇas gathered in great crowds.

source_sentence: 懸繒幡蓋，燒香散花，鳴鍾擊鼓，作諸伎樂；以七寶器，盛四海水，諸仙人眾，各各頂戴授婆羅門；如是乃至遍及諸臣，悉已頂戴，傳授與王。
translation: They hung silken banners and flags, burned incense and scattered flowers, sounded bells and beat drums, and performed various tricks; they filled four waters with seven-jewel vessels, and each of the sages put their head on and gave them to the brāhmaṇas; and so on, all the ministers put their heads on and passed them on to the king.

source_sentence: 時王即以灌太子頂，以七寶印而用付之，又擊大鼓，高聲唱言：『今立薩婆悉達以為太子。』
translation: The king then consecrated the crown prince's head, bestowed a seal of seven treasures on him, and beat a large drum, singing aloud, 'Now I've made Sapta Siddhârtha the crown prince.'

source_sentence: 爾時虛空天、龍、夜叉、人非人等，作天伎樂，異口同音讚言：『善哉！』
translation: At that point, the gods, dragons, yakṣas, humans, and nonhumans of space created celestial music and praised him with one voice, saying, 'Good!'

source_sentence: 當於迦毘羅斾兜國立太子時，餘八國王，亦於是日同立太子。
translation: When the crown prince was installed in Kapilavastu, the other eight kings also installed a crown prince on that day.

source_sentence: 「爾時太子，啟王出遊，王即聽許。
translation: "The crown prince then invited the king to travel, and the king gave his assent.

source_sentence: 時王即與太子并諸群臣，前後導從，按行國界，次復前行；到王田所，即便止息，閻浮樹下，看諸耕人。
translation: The king then led the prince and his ministers from front to back, proceeded according to the boundaries of the country, and then went on to the king's fields, where they stopped to look at the plowmen under the jambu trees.

source_sentence: 爾時淨居天，化作壤蟲，烏隨啄之。
translation: It was then that the Jñānagupta gods turned into loam worms, and a crow followed them and pecked at them.

source_sentence: 太子見已，起慈悲心，眾生可愍，互相吞食；即便思惟：『離欲界愛，如是乃至得四禪地。』
translation: After he saw that, the prince became compassionate, pitying sentient beings and devouring each other, and even thought, 'Parting with craving for the desire realm, I'll go so far as to attain the fourth meditative ground.'

source_sentence: 日光昕赫，樹為曲枝，隨蔭太子。
translation: The sun shone brightly, and a tree bent its branches to shadow the prince.

source_sentence: 爾時白淨王，四面推求，問覓太子；從人答曰：『太子今在閻浮樹下。』
translation: King Baekjeong then looked around and asked for the prince; they were answered, 'The prince is now under the Jambudvīpa tree.'

source_sentence: 時王即便與諸群臣，往彼樹所，未至之間，遙見太子端坐思惟，又見彼樹曲蔭其軀，深生奇特。
translation: The king then went with his ministers to the tree, and before he reached it, he saw the prince sitting calmly and reflecting, and he saw the tree twisted and shaded by his body, which was deeply peculiar.

source_sentence: 時王即前執太子手問言：『汝今何故在於此坐？』
translation: The king then took the prince's hand and asked, 'Why are you sitting here now?'

source_sentence: 太子答言：『觀諸眾生，更相吞食，甚可傷愍。』
translation: The prince answered, 'It's sad to see all these sentient beings devouring each other.'

source_sentence: 王聞此語，心生憂惱，慮其出家，宜急婚娉以悅其意，即便呼之：『俱共還國。』
translation: When the king heard this, he became sad and troubled, considering that he had left home and that it would be appropriate to give him a quick marriage to please him, and he called out to him, 'Let's all return to the country.'

source_sentence: 太子答言：『願停於此。』
translation: The prince answered, 'We'd like to stop here.'

source_sentence: 王聞其語，心即念言：『彼阿私陀往日所說，太子今者將如其言。』
translation: When the king heard what he said, he thought to himself, 'That Ashita taught us in the past, and now the prince will do as he says.'

source_sentence: 王即流淚重喚：『還國。』
translation: The king then called again with tears in his eyes, 'Return to the country.'

source_sentence: 太子既見父王如此，即便隨從，歸於所止。
translation: Seeing how his father had behaved, the prince even followed him and returned to his lodging.

source_sentence: 王恐愁憂，不樂在家，更增妓女，而娛樂之。
translation: Afraid and worried, the king didn't want to stay home, so he added a prostitute and entertained him.

source_sentence: 「爾時太子，至年十七，王集諸臣，而共議言：『太子今者年已長大，宜應為其訪索婚所。』
translation: "When the prince reached the age of 17, the king gathered his ministers together and discussed the matter, saying, 'Now that the prince has grown up, it would be appropriate to find a place for him to marry.'

source_sentence: 諸臣答言：『有一釋種婆羅門，名摩訶那摩，其人有女，名耶輸陀羅，顏容端正，聰明智慧，賢才過人，禮儀備舉，有如是德，堪太子妃。』
translation: The ministers answered, 'There's a Brahmin of the Śākyas named Mahānāma who has a daughter named Yaśodharā, with a handsome face, intelligence, wisdom, superior intelligence, and a high standard of decorum, who has such qualities that she would be suitable for the crown prince's consort.'

source_sentence: 王即答言：『若如卿語，便為納之。』
translation: The king then replied, 'If it's as you say, I'll accept her.'

source_sentence: 王還宮內，即勅宮中聰明有智舊宿女人：『汝可往至摩訶那摩長者之家，瞻看其女，容儀禮行，為何如耶？
translation: Returning to the palace, the king commanded the wise old woman in the palace, 'Would you go to the house of the elder Mahānāma and examine her daughter, her appearance, her manners, and her conduct?'

source_sentence: 可停於彼至滿七日。』
translation: You may stay there until the seventh day is up.'

source_sentence: 受王勅已，即便往彼長者之家，於七日中，具觀此女。
translation: After receiving the king's command, he went to that elder's house and spent seven days there observing the woman in detail.

source_sentence: 還答王言：『我觀此女，容貌端正，威儀進止，無與等者。』
translation: He answered the king, 'I've observed this woman, and she has a fine appearance and a manner of deportment that's not equal to her.'

source_sentence: 王聞其言，極大歡喜，即便遣人語摩訶那摩言：『太子年長，欲為納妃。』
translation: Hearing his words, the king was overjoyed and even sent someone to tell Mahānāma, 'The prince is old and wants to take her as his consort.'

source_sentence: 諸臣並言：『汝女淑令，宜堪此舉，今欲相屈。』
translation: The ministers also said, 'Your daughter is a suitable lady for this task, and now she wants to yield to him.'

source_sentence: 時摩訶那摩，答王使言：『謹奉勅旨。』
translation: Mahānāma then answered the king's envoy, 'I've received your order.'

source_sentence: 王即令諸臣擇採吉日，遣車萬乘，而往迎之。
translation: The king then ordered his ministers to choose an auspicious day and send chariots of ten thousand vehicles to meet him.

source_sentence: 既至宮已，具足太子婚姻之禮，又復更增諸妓女眾，晝夜娛樂。
translation: When they arrived at the palace, they performed the marriage ceremony for the crown prince and added a host of prostitutes to entertain him day and night.

source_sentence: 爾時太子，恒與其妃，行、住、坐、臥，未曾不俱；初自無有世俗之意，於靜夜中，但修禪觀。
translation: At the time, the prince was always walking, standing, sitting, and lying down with his wife, and there was never a time when they didn't have worldly intentions at first.

source_sentence: 時王日日問諸婇女：『太子與妃，相接近不？』
translation: The king then asked the women day after day, 'Are the prince and his consort close to each other?'

source_sentence: 婇女答言：『不見太子有夫婦道。』
translation: The female replied, 'I don't see the prince in the path of a husband and wife.'

source_sentence: 王聞此語，愁憂不樂，更增妓女，而娛樂之；如是經時，猶不接近，時王深疑恐不能男。
translation: When the king heard this, he became sad and unhappy, and he added more prostitutes to entertain him; after going on like this for a while, they still wouldn't come near, and the king was deeply suspicious and afraid that he wouldn't be able to have a man.

source_sentence: 「爾時太子，聞諸妓女歌詠，園林花果茂盛，流泉清涼，太子忽便欲出遊觀；即遣妓女，往白王言：『在宮日久，樂欲暫出園林遊戲。』
translation: "It was then that the prince heard the prostitutes singing, and when the garden was filled with flowers and fruits, and the fountains were cool and clear, the prince suddenly wanted to go out and look around.

source_sentence: 王聞此語，心生歡喜，而自念言：『太子當是不樂在宮行夫婦禮，所以求出園林去耳。』
translation: When the king heard this, his heart rejoiced, and he thought to himself, 'The prince probably doesn't want to perform conjugal rituals in the palace, so he wants to go out to the garden.'

source_sentence: 即便聽之，勅諸群臣：『整治園觀，所經道路，皆令清淨。』
translation: He then listened and commanded his ministers, 'Train the park and make the paths through it clean.'

source_sentence: 太子即便往至王所頭面禮足，辭出而去。
translation: The crown prince then went to the king, bowed his head and feet, excused himself, and departed.

source_sentence: 時王即便勅一舊臣聰明智慧善言辯者，令從太子。
translation: The king then ordered an old minister who was wise, intelligent, and well-spoken to follow the crown prince.

source_sentence: 爾時太子，與諸官屬，前後導從，出城東門，國中人民，聞太子出，男女盈路，觀者如雲。
translation: The crown prince and his officials led him out of the east gate of the city, and when the people of the country heard that the crown prince had left, the roads were filled with men and women, and there were clouds of people watching him.

source_sentence: 時淨居天，化作老人，頭白背傴，拄杖羸步。
translation: He was then transformed into an old man with a white head and a slender back, and he was walking with a staff.

source_sentence: 太子即便問從者言：『此為何人？』
translation: The prince then asked his followers, 'Who is this man?'

source_sentence: 從者答曰：『此老人也。』
translation: The attendant replied, 'This is an old man.'

source_sentence: 太子又問：『何謂為老。』
translation: The prince then asked, 'What's the meaning of old age?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『此人昔日曾經嬰兒童子少年，遷謝不住，遂至根熟，形變色衰，飲食不消，氣力虛微，坐起苦極，餘命無幾，故謂為老。』
translation: He replied, 'In the past, this person was a young boy and a youth who couldn't stop moving and ageing, and then his faculties matured, his appearance changed and declined, his diet failed, his energy was weak, sitting up was extremely painful, and his remaining life was not long, so he was called old.'

source_sentence: 太子又問：『唯此人老？
translation: The prince also asked, 'Is this person the only one who's old?'

source_sentence: 一切皆然？』
translation: is everything so?'

source_sentence: 從者答言：『一切皆悉應當如此。』
translation: The followers replied, 'So it should be with everything.'

source_sentence: 爾時太子，聞是語已，生大苦惱，而自念言：『日月流邁，時變歲移，老至如電，身安足恃！
translation: After hearing those words, the prince became greatly distressed and thought to himself, 'The sun and moon go by, time changes, and years pass, and old age is like lightning; I don't have enough to rely on!'

source_sentence: 我雖富貴，豈獨免耶？
translation: Although I am wealthy and powerful, am I alone in being spared?

source_sentence: 云何世人，而不怖畏？』
translation: How can a person not be afraid?'

source_sentence: 太子從本以來，不樂處世，又聞此事，益生厭離；即迴車還，愁思不樂。
translation: Since long ago, the prince had been unhappy in the world, and hearing this, he became increasingly disillusioned; he returned to his chariot, sad and unhappy.

source_sentence: 時王聞已，心懷煎憂，恐其學道；更增妓女，以娛樂之。
translation: When the king heard about this, he was troubled at heart and was afraid he might train in the way; he added a prostitute to entertain him.

source_sentence: 「爾時太子，復經少時，啟王出遊。
translation: "It was then that the prince, after a short time, again invited the king to go on a tour.

source_sentence: 王聞此言，心生憂慮，而自念言：『太子前出，逢見老人，憂愁不樂，今者云何，而復求出？』
translation: When the king heard those words, his mind became worried, and he thought to himself, 'The prince was sad and unhappy when he met the old man on his previous journey; why is he now seeking to leave again?'

source_sentence: 王愛太子，不忍違異，僶俛從之；即集諸臣，而共議言：『太子前者出城東門，逢見老人，還輙不樂；今者已復求出遊觀，吾不能免，遂復許之。』
translation: The king loved the prince so much that he couldn't bear to disagree with him and agreed with him.

source_sentence: 諸臣答言：『當更嚴勅外諸官屬，修治道路，懸繒幡蓋，散華燒香，皆使華麗，無令臭穢諸不淨潔，及以老病在道側也。』
translation: The ministers replied, 'I'll tell the outer officials to make sure the roads are maintained, hang silken banners and shrouds, scatter flowers and burn incense, and make them beautiful so that they don't become smelly and unclean, and so that old people and sick people don't get on the side of the roads.'

source_sentence: 「爾時迦毘羅斾兜城四門之外，各有一園，樹木花果，浴池樓觀，種種莊嚴，皆悉無異。
translation: "At the time, outside the four gates of the city of Kapilavastu, there was a park with trees, flowers, fruits, baths, ponds, and buildings, all of which were remarkably ornate.

source_sentence: 王問諸臣：『外諸園觀，何者為勝？』
translation: The king asked the ministers, 'Which of these external gardens and mansions is superior?'

source_sentence: 諸臣答言：『外諸園觀，皆等無異，如忉利天歡喜之園。』
translation: The ministers replied, 'The external parks are all the same, just like the joyous park in the Heaven of Thirty-three.'

source_sentence: 王又勅言：『太子前出，已從東門；今者可令從南門出。』
translation: The king also commanded them, 'The crown prince left the city through the east gate; now, he can make it leave through the south gate.'

source_sentence: 爾時太子，百官導從，出城南門。
translation: The prince was then guided by a hundred officials out of the south gate of the city.

source_sentence: 時淨居天，化作病人，身瘦腹大，喘息呻吟，骨消肉竭，顏貌痿黃，舉身戰掉，不能自持，兩人扶腋，在於路側。
translation: He was transformed into a sick man in the Pure Land gods, with a thin body and a large belly, panting and groaning, his bones wasted away, his face was impotent, and he was unable to hold himself up as he held his body up by his arms with two people on the side of the road.

source_sentence: 太子即問：『此為何人？』
translation: The prince then asked, 'Who is this person?'

source_sentence: 從者答曰：『此病人也。』
translation: The attendant replied, 'This is a sick person.'

source_sentence: 太子又問：『何謂為病？』
translation: The prince then asked, 'What's meant by sickness?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『夫謂病者，皆由嗜欲，飲食無度，四大不調，轉變成病，百節苦痛，氣力虛微，飲食寡少，眠臥不安，雖有身手，不能自運，要假他力，然後坐起。』
translation: He answered, 'A person who is ill is caused by craving, inordinate eating and drinking, and the four major disorders that result in illness, pain in a hundred joints, weak energy, little food and drink, restless sleep, and uneasiness, and although he has the body and hands, he can't move himself; he has to rely on the strength of others before he can sit up.'

source_sentence: 爾時太子，以慈悲心，看彼病人，自生愁憂。
translation: The prince then, with compassion, looked at that sick man and expressed his own sadness.

source_sentence: 又復問言：『此人獨爾？
translation: He also asked, 'Is this person alone?'

source_sentence: 餘皆然耶？』
translation: Are all the others so?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『一切人民，無有貴賤，同有此病。』
translation: He answered, 'All people, high and low, share this illness.'

source_sentence: 太子聞已，心自念言：『如此病苦，普應嬰之，云何世人，耽樂不畏？』
translation: After hearing this, the prince thought to himself, 'Such illnesses and pains should affect babies everywhere, so why do people not fear them with joy?'

source_sentence: 作此念已，深生恐怖，身心戰動，譬如月影現波浪水。
translation: After that thought, he becomes deeply frightened, and his body and mind are tossed about like the moon's shadow appearing in billowing water.

source_sentence: 語從者言：『如此身者，是大苦聚，世人於中，撗生歡樂，愚癡無識，不知覺悟；今者云何，欲往彼園遊觀嬉戲？』
translation: He says to his followers, 'Such a body is a great mass of suffering, in which people are delighted, foolish and without consciousness, and don't know enlightenment; why do you want to go to that park to look around and play?'

source_sentence: 即便迴車，還入王宮，坐自思惟，愁憂不樂。
translation: He then returned to his chariot and went back into the king's palace, where he sat down to reflect on himself and became sad and unhappy.

source_sentence: 王問從者：『太子今出，寧有樂不？』
translation: The king asked his attendants, 'Now that the prince has left, would he rather have happiness?'

source_sentence: 從者答言：『始出南門，逢見病人，以此不樂，即迴車還。』
translation: The attendant replied, 'I had just left the south gate and met a sick man. I was unhappy about this, so I returned in my chariot.'

source_sentence: 王聞此語，心大愁憂，慮其出家。
translation: When the king heard this, his heart was greatly distressed, and he considered leaving home.

source_sentence: 時王即便問諸臣言：『太子前者出城東門，逢見老人愁憂不樂，以此事故，吾勅卿等，淨治道路，無令老病在於巷側，云何今出於城南門，而復致有疾病人耶？
translation: The king then asked his ministers, 'When the prince left the east gate of the city and met an elderly man who was sad and unhappy, I ordered you to cleanse the roads so that old people and sick people wouldn't be on the side of the streets.

source_sentence: 又令太子逢值見之。』
translation: He also told the prince to meet with him.'

source_sentence: 諸臣答言：『近受王勅，嚴命外司，勿使有諸臭穢老病在於道側，互相撿覆，無敢懈怠，不知何緣忽有病人，非是我等之罪咎也。』
translation: The ministers answered, 'I've recently received a command from the king to strictly order the foreign ministers not to allow smelly, old, or sick people to be on the side of the road, to pick each other up, and not to dare to be lazy. I don't know why there are suddenly sick people, but it's not our fault.'

source_sentence: 爾時王問諸從者言：『汝等並見病人在路何從而至？』
translation: The king then asked the attendants, 'Do you see any sick people on the road and how did they get there?'

source_sentence: 從者答曰：『無有蹤跡，不知何來？』
translation: The follower replied, 'There's no trace of it; I wonder where it came from?'

source_sentence: 時王深於太子生猶豫心，恐其學道，更增妓女，而悅其意，又復欲使於五欲中生戀著心。
translation: The king then became deeply hesitant about the prince, fearing that he might train in the way and become more of a prostitute to please him, and he also wanted to cause him to become attached to the five desires.

source_sentence: 「爾時有一婆羅門子，名憂陀夷，聰明智慧，極有才辯。
translation: "At the time, there was a Brāhmaṇa named udāna, who was intelligent, wise, and highly eloquent.

source_sentence: 時王即便請來入宮，而語之言：『太子今者，不樂在世受於五欲，恐其不久，出家學道；汝可與之共作朋屬，具說世間五欲樂事，令其心動不樂出家。』
translation: The king then invited him into his palace and told him, 'Now, the prince doesn't like the five worldly pleasures, and he's afraid that he might leave home soon to train on the path; why don't you make him a companion and tell him about the five worldly pleasures so that his mind will be moved to leave home?'

source_sentence: 時優陀夷，即便答言：『太子聰明，無與等者，所知書論，皆悉淵博，並是我今所未曾聞，云何見使誘說之耶？
translation: Udayinī then answered, 'The prince's intelligence is unequalled, and his knowledge of books and discussions is so vast that I've never heard of them before.

source_sentence: 譬以藕絲欲懸須彌，我亦如是，終不能迴太子之心。
translation: 'It's like trying to hang Sumeru by a lotus root, and so am I. Eventually, I won't be able to turn back the prince's mind.

source_sentence: 大王既勅令作朋友，要當自竭我所知見。』
translation: Since the king has commanded me to be his friend, I must exhaust what I know and see for myself.'

source_sentence: 時優陀夷受王勅已，隨從太子，行住坐臥，不敢遠離。
translation: After the king commanded him, Udayinī followed the prince, walking, sitting, and lying down, not daring to stray far from him.

source_sentence: 時王又復選諸妓女，聰明智慧，顏容端正，善於歌舞，能惑人者；種種莊飾，光麗悅目，皆悉遣往給侍太子。
translation: The king then also chose prostitutes who were intelligent, wise, well-presented, good at singing and dancing, and capable of seducing people, and who were decorated in various ways that were beautiful and eye-pleasing, and sent them all to serve the prince.

source_sentence: 「爾時太子，復經少時，啟王出遊。
translation: "After a short time, the prince then again invited the king to go on a tour.

source_sentence: 王聞此語，心自念言：『彼優陀夷，既與太子共為朋友，今若出遊，或勝於前，無復厭俗樂出家心。』
translation: When the king heard this, he thought to himself, 'That Udayin is a friend of the prince's, so perhaps if he went on a trip now, he'd be better than before, and he'd no longer be disillusioned with the worldly pleasures of leaving home.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，即便聽許。
translation: After he thought this, he even accepted it.

source_sentence: 時王又復集諸大臣，悉語之言：『太子今者復求出遊，我不忍違，已復聽之；太子前出東南二門，已見老病，還輙憂愁；今者宜令從西門出。
translation: The king then also gathered his ministers together and told them, 'Now that the prince is again seeking to travel, I can't bear to disobey him and have already listened; the prince left the southeast gate twice before, but he saw that he was old and sick and became sad when he returned.

source_sentence: 我心慮其還又不樂；然優陀夷，是其良友，冀今出還，不復應爾。
translation: I was worried that he wouldn't be happy to return, but Udayinī is a good friend of his, so I hope he leaves now and returns, but he won't agree to it.

source_sentence: 卿等好令修治道路園林臺觀，皆使嚴整，香華幡蓋，數倍於前，無令復有老病臭穢在道側也。』
translation: Please make sure that the roads, gardens, groves, and terraces are kept neat and tidy, and that there are many more flowers, banners, and shrouds than before, so that there will be no more old age, sickness, or filth on the sides of the roads.'

source_sentence: 臣受勅已，即語外司，嚴治道路，并及園林，光麗倍常。
translation: After I received the order, I told the foreign ministers to make the roads and gardens more or less neat and beautiful than before.

source_sentence: 王又先送諸妙妓女，置彼園中；又復勅語優陀夷言：『若當路側，有不祥事，可以方便誘悅其心。』
translation: The king first sent some wonderful prostitutes to place in the park, and then he also commanded Udayin to say, 'If there's anything ominous on the side of the road, you can skillfully entice their minds.'

source_sentence: 并勅諸臣，隨從太子，皆令伺察，若有不吉，遠驅逐之。
translation: He also commanded his ministers to follow the prince and order them to watch for anything unlucky and drive them far away.

source_sentence: 「爾時太子，與優陀夷，百官導從，燒香散花，作眾伎樂，出城西門。
translation: "It was then that the prince, Udayinī, and his hundred officials led them out of the west gate of the city, burning incense and scattering flowers, and creating a multitude of music.

source_sentence: 時淨居天，心自念言：『先現老病於二城門，舉眾皆見，令白淨王嗔責從者并及外司。
translation: The Jñānacitra gods then said to themselves, 'The public saw the old and sick at the gates of the two cities and told the king of Jñānacitra to tell them to rebuke their followers and the outside ministers.

source_sentence: 太子今出，王制嚴峻，我今現死，若皆見者，增王忿怒，必加罰戮抂及無辜；我於今日所現之事，唯令太子及憂陀夷二人見耳，使餘官屬不受責也。』
translation: Now that the prince is out, the king's regulations are strict, and if everyone sees my death now, it will increase the king's anger and cause him to punish those who are unreasonable and innocent; the only people I've shown today are the prince and Udraka, so that the rest of my officials won't be blamed.'

source_sentence: 作此念已，即便來下，化為死人，四人舉輿，以諸香華，布散屍上，室家大小，號哭送之。
translation: After he had this thought, he even descended and was transformed into a dead man. Four people carried a palanquin, scattered flowers and incense on the corpse, and sent it off with shouts and tears from the members of his household.

source_sentence: 爾時太子與優陀夷，二人獨見。
translation: The prince and Udāyin then saw them alone.

source_sentence: 太子問言：『此為何物？
translation: The prince asked, 'What is this thing?'

source_sentence: 而以花香，莊飾其上，復有人眾，號哭相送。』
translation: They adorned them with flowers and fragrances, and there were crowds of people wailing and weeping as they sent them off.'

source_sentence: 時優陀夷，以王勅故，默然不答。
translation: Udayinī then, because the king had commanded him to, remained silent and didn't answer.

source_sentence: 如是三問，淨居天王威神之力，使優陀夷不覺答言：『是死人也。』
translation: After these three questions, the King of the Pure Land's authoritative power caused Udāyin to unconsciously reply, 'This is a dead person.'

source_sentence: 太子又問：『何謂為死？』
translation: The prince then asked, 'What's meant by dead?'

source_sentence: 優陀夷言：『夫謂死者，刀風解形，神識去矣，四體諸根，無所復知。
translation: Udāyin said, 'A dead person is said to have had their form dissolved by the wind of a sword, their consciousness gone, and the four bodily faculties no longer known.

source_sentence: 此人在世，貪著五欲，愛惜錢財，辛苦經營，唯知積聚，不識無常；今者一旦捨之而死，又為父母親戚眷屬之所愛念；命終之後，猶如草木，恩情好惡，不復相關。
translation: While in the world, this person was addicted to the five desires, cherished money and possessions, and worked hard to accumulate only accumulation without realizing impermanence; now, once they abandon them and die, they're loved by their parents, relatives, and dependents; after their life ends, they're like grass and trees, and their good and bad feelings are no longer relevant.

source_sentence: 如是死者，誠可哀也。』
translation: Such a deceased person is truly to be pitied.'

source_sentence: 太子聞已，心大戰怖。
translation: After hearing this, the prince's heart was greatly disturbed.

source_sentence: 又問優陀夷言：『唯此人死？
translation: He also asked Udayin, 'Is this the only person who's died?'

source_sentence: 餘亦當然？』
translation: Surely the rest?'

source_sentence: 即復答言：『一切世人，皆應如此，無有貴賤而得免脫。』
translation: He then answered, 'So it should be with all people, for there's no higher or lower level that they can be freed from.'

source_sentence: 「太子素性，恬靜難動，既聞此語，不能自安。
translation: "The prince, who by nature was quiet and difficult to move, heard these words and couldn't bring himself to stop.

source_sentence: 即以微聲，語優陀夷：『世間乃復有此死苦，云何於中，而行放逸，心如木石不知怖畏？』
translation: He spoke to Udāyin in a whisper, 'Even though this world suffers from death, why is it that you act carelessly in it, not knowing fear when your mind is like wood and stone?'

source_sentence: 即勅御者可迴車還。
translation: I then ordered the royal servant to return in his chariot.

source_sentence: 御者答言：『前出二門，未到園所，中路而反，致令大王深見瞋責；今者豈敢復如此耶？』
translation: The imperial servant replied, 'I left the two gates before and turned back in the middle of the road before I reached the park, which caused the king to be deeply angry; how dare I do that again?'

source_sentence: 時優陀夷，語御者言：『如汝所說，不應便歸。』
translation: Udāyin then said to the royal servant, 'As you say, you shouldn't go back right now.'

source_sentence: 即復前行，至彼園中，香華幡蓋，作眾伎樂；眾妓端正，猶如諸天婇女無異，於太子前，各競歌舞冀以姿態，悅動其意。
translation: He then went on ahead and found himself in a park with flowers, banners, and decorations, and a multitude of musicians and courtesans as correct as any goddess in the heavens, each competing in song and dance before the prince with a gesture that pleased his mind.

source_sentence: 太子心安，不可移轉，即止園中，蔭息樹間，除其侍衛，端坐思惟，憶昔曾在閻浮樹下，遠離欲界，乃至得於第四禪定。
translation: Secure in mind and unable to be distracted, the prince stopped in the garden, took a resting place in the shade of a tree, removed his attendants, and sat calmly reflecting as he remembered how he had once been under the Jambudvīpa tree, secluded from the desire realm, and attained the fourth dhyāna concentration.

source_sentence: 「爾時優陀夷，到太子所，而作此言：『大王見勅，令與太子共為朋友，脫有得失，互相開悟，朋友之法，其要有三：一者、見有過失輙相諫曉；二者、見有好事，深生隨喜；三者、在於苦厄，不相棄捨。
translation: "It was then that Udāyin went to the prince and said, 'The king has seen fit to order that he and the prince be friends, free from gain and loss and enlightened by each other.

source_sentence: 今獻誠言，願不見責。
translation: I now offer these sincere words, hoping that I won't be rebuked.

source_sentence: 古昔諸王，及今現在，皆悉受於五欲之樂，然後出家；太子云何，永絕不顧？
translation: Kings of yore and the present are all subject to the five pleasures and then leave home; how could the prince never have regard for them?

source_sentence: 又人生世，宜順人行，無有棄國而學道者。
translation: 'Also, in this world it's appropriate to follow the ways of people, so there's no one who abandons their country and trains on the path.

source_sentence: 唯願太子，受於五欲，令有子息，不絕王嗣。』
translation: May the prince accept the five desires so that there will be children and the king's heir will not be cut off.'

source_sentence: 爾時太子，而答之言：『誠如所說，但我不以捐國故爾，亦復不言五欲無樂；以畏老病生死之苦故，於五欲不敢愛著。
translation: The prince then answered, 'It's true what you've said, but I don't say that it's because I've abandoned my country, and I don't say that the five desires lack pleasure because I'm afraid of the suffering of old age, illness, birth, and death, so I don't dare to get attached to the five desires.

source_sentence: 汝向所言，古昔諸王，先經五欲，然後出家。
translation: You've said that in ancient times, kings first experienced the five desires and then left home.

source_sentence: 此諸王等，今在何許？
translation: Where are these kings now?

source_sentence: 以愛欲故，或在地獄，或在餓鬼，或在畜生，或在人天；以有如是輪轉苦故，是以我欲離老病苦生死法耳。
translation: Because of craving and desire, I might end up in hell, a hungry ghost, an animal, or a human god; because of such painful transmigration, I want to part with the law of birth-and-death from old age, illness, and suffering.

source_sentence: 汝今云何令我受之？』
translation: Now, how would you have me accept it?'

source_sentence: 時優陀夷，雖竭才辯勸獎太子，不能令迴，即便退坐，歸於所止。
translation: Udāyin tried his best to persuade the prince to turn away, but he withdrew from his seat and returned to his lodging.

source_sentence: 太子仍勅嚴駕還宮，諸妓女眾，及優陀夷，愁憂慘慼，顏貌顰蹙，如人新喪所愛親屬；太子到宮，惻愴倍常。
translation: The crown prince then ordered Udāyin to return to the palace. The crowd of prostitutes and Udāyin were sad and miserable, and their faces were downcast like a person's newly bereaved relative; when the crown prince arrived at the palace, his sympathy was twice as great as usual.

source_sentence: 「時白淨王，呼優陀夷，而問之言：『太子今出，寧有樂不？』
translation: "Then King Baishen summoned Udāyin and asked him, 'Would the prince rather have pleasure now that he's gone?'

source_sentence: 優陀夷言：『出城不遠，逢見死人，亦不知其從何而來，太子與我，同時見之。
translation: Udayin said, 'I didn't go far from the city when I met a dead man, and I didn't know where he had come from.

source_sentence: 太子問言：「此為何人？」
translation: The prince asked, 'Who is this man?'

source_sentence: 我亦不覺，答是死人。』
translation: I didn't realize it either, but I answered, 'It's a dead man.'

source_sentence: 時王即復問諸從者：『汝等皆見城西門外有死人不？』
translation: The king then asked his followers, 'Have you all seen a dead man outside the city's west gate?'

source_sentence: 從者答言：『我等不見。』
translation: The followers replied, 'We haven't seen them.'

source_sentence: 王聞此語，神意豁然，而自念言：『太子、優陀夷，二人獨見，此是天力，非諸臣咎，必定當如阿私陀言。』
translation: Hearing this, the king's mind was awakened, and he thought to himself, 'The prince and Udāyin see this alone; this is the power of heaven, not the fault of ministers; it will surely be as Ashita said.'

source_sentence: 作此念已，心大苦惱，復增妓女，以娛樂之；日日遣人，慰誘太子，而語之言：『國是汝有，何故愁憂，而不樂耶？』
translation: After that thought, he was greatly distressed, and he added another prostitute to his entertainment. Every day, he sent someone to comfort the prince and told him, 'You own the country; why are you so sad and unhappy?'

source_sentence: 王又嚴勅諸妓女眾，悅太子意，勿捨晝夜。
translation: The king also strictly ordered the crowd of prostitutes to please the prince and not to let go of day and night.

source_sentence: 「時白淨王，雖知天力非復人事，愛重太子，不能不言。
translation: "Although he knew that the power of gods was not human, King Baekjeong loved and respected the prince, and he couldn't stop talking about it.

source_sentence: 心自思惟：『太子前已出三城門，今者唯有北門未出，其必不久更求出遊；當復莊嚴彼外園林，倍令光麗，勿使有諸不可意事。』
translation: He thought to himself, 'The prince has already left the three gates of the city, but now he's left only the northern gate, so he'll surely want to go out again soon; he must again adorn the park outside there and make it twice as beautiful, so that nothing unexpected will happen to it.'

source_sentence: 如所思惟，具勅諸臣。
translation: He thought about it and commanded his ministers to do so.

source_sentence: 時王又復心自願言：『太子若出城北門時，唯願諸天，勿復現於不吉祥事，復令我子心生憂惱。』
translation: The king then again mentally volunteered, 'When the prince leaves the northern gate of the city, I hope the gods won't again show up anything inauspicious and cause my son to become sad.'

source_sentence: 既心願已，遂勅御者：『太子若出，當令乘馬，使得四望，見諸人民，光麗莊飾。』
translation: Having made that mental wish, he then commanded the ruler, 'When the prince leaves, he will make them ride on a horse and make them look around to see the people in resplendent adornment.'

source_sentence: 「是時太子，啟王出遊；王不忍違，便與優陀夷及餘官屬，前後導從，出城北門。
translation: "The king couldn't bear to disobey him, so he went out with Udāyin and the rest of his retinue and guided them out the northern gate of the city.

source_sentence: 到彼園所，太子下馬，止息於樹，除去侍衛，端坐思惟，念於世間老病死苦。
translation: When they arrived at the garden, the prince dismounted from his horse, stopped at a tree, removed his guards, and sat down to reflect on the suffering of old age, illness, and death in this world.

source_sentence: 時淨居天，化作比丘，法服持鉢，手執錫杖，視地而行，在太子前。
translation: At the time, a god Jñānacī took the form of a monk, wearing his robes and carrying his bowl, and he carried a tin cane in his hand as he looked down at the ground and walked in front of the prince.

source_sentence: 太子見已，即便問言：『汝是何人？』
translation: When the prince saw him, he even asked, 'Who are you?'

source_sentence: 比丘答言：『我是比丘。』
translation: The monk answered, 'I am a monk.'

source_sentence: 太子又問：『何謂比丘？』
translation: The prince then asked, 'What's a monk?'

source_sentence: 答言：『能破結賊，不受後身，故曰比丘。
translation: He replied, 'He's called a monk because he can break the bonds and thieves and won't be subject to a later life.

source_sentence: 世間皆悉無常危脆，我所修學，無漏聖道，不著色聲香味觸法，永得無為，到解脫岸。』
translation: The world is all impermanent and fragile, but I've cultivated the untainted noble path, not clinging to form, sound, smells, tastes, and tactile objects, and I've attained nothingness forever and reached the shore of liberation.'

source_sentence: 作此言已，於太子前，現神通力，騰虛而去。
translation: After he said this, he demonstrated his supernormal powers in front of the prince, soared into the sky, and departed.

source_sentence: 當爾之時，諸從官屬，皆悉覩見。
translation: At the time, the officials in charge of the monk's household all saw him.

source_sentence: 太子既已見此比丘，又聞廣說出家功德，會其宿懷厭欲之情，便自唱言：『善哉！
translation: Having seen this monk and heard him extensively explain the virtues of leaving home, the prince then recognized his long-held feelings of disillusionment with desire and called out to himself, 'Good!

source_sentence: 善哉！
translation: Bravo!

source_sentence: 天人之中，唯此為勝，我當決定修學是道。』
translation: Among gods and humans, this is the only one who's superior, and I will definitely train in this path.'

source_sentence: 作此語已，即便索馬還歸宮城。
translation: After he said this, he even took his horse and returned to the palace.

source_sentence: 於時太子，心生欣慶，而自念言：『我先見有老病死苦，晝夜常恐為此所逼；今見比丘，開悟我情，示解脫路。』
translation: The prince then rejoiced in his heart and said to himself, 'I've seen the suffering of old age, illness, and death before, and I was always afraid that it would constrain me day and night.

source_sentence: 作此念已，即自思惟方便，求覓出家因緣。
translation: After he had this thought, he then considered the way to seek the causes and conditions for leaving home.

source_sentence: 「爾時白淨王問優陀夷言：『太子今出，寧有樂不？』
translation: "It was then that King Baishen asked Udāyin, 'Would the prince leave now and have any joy?'

source_sentence: 時優陀夷即答王言：『太子向出，所經道路，無諸不祥；既到園中，太子獨自在於樹下，遙見一人，剃除鬚髮，著染色衣，來太子前而共言語。
translation: Udāyin then answered the king, 'The prince was headed out, and the road he traveled was clear of anything ominous; when he arrived in the garden, he was alone under a tree when he saw a man with shaved hair and dyed clothing come before the prince and speak with him.

source_sentence: 言語既畢，騰虛而去，竟亦不知何所論說，太子因是嚴駕而歸。
translation: After he finished speaking, he rose into the sky and departed, not knowing what to say, the prince returned with a dignified carriage.

source_sentence: 當爾之時，顏容歡悅，還至宮中，方生憂愁。』
translation: At the time, his countenance was joyous and happy, but when he returned to the palace, he was sad.'

source_sentence: 時白淨王，既聞此語，心生狐疑，亦復不知是何瑞相，深懷懊惱，而自念言：『太子決定捨家學道，又納其妃，久而無子，我今應勅耶輸陀羅，當思方便莫絕國嗣；復應警戒，勿使太子去而不知。』
translation: Having heard this, King Baishen had misgivings, didn't know what the auspicious sign was, and was deeply distressed. He thought to himself, 'The prince has decided to leave home and train on the path, and he has taken his wife for a long time without a child.

source_sentence: 既作是念，如所思惟，即便勅於耶輸陀羅。
translation: Having thought this, he thus considered it, and even then he ordered Yāchodra to give him an order.

source_sentence: 耶輸陀羅聞王勅已，心懷慚愧，默然而住，行止坐臥不離太子。
translation: After hearing the king's command, Yaśodharā's heart felt ashamed, and he quietly stayed, walking, sitting, and lying down without leaving the prince.

source_sentence: 時王復增諸妙妓女，以娛樂之。
translation: The king then added other wonderful prostitutes to entertain him.

source_sentence: 「爾時太子年至十九，心自思惟：『我今正是出家之時。』
translation: "When he reached the age of 19, the prince thought to himself, 'Now is the right time for me to leave home.'

source_sentence: 而便往至於父王所，威儀庠序，猶如帝釋，往詣梵天，傍臣見已，而白王言：『太子今者來大王所。』
translation: He then went to his father's palace and was resplendent in manner, just like the emperor and the noble ones, and went up to the Brahma heavens. When the ministers saw him, they said to the king, 'Now, the crown prince has come to the great king.'

source_sentence: 王聞此言，憂喜交集。
translation: When the king heard this, he was overcome with sadness and joy.

source_sentence: 太子既至，頭面作禮；爾時父王，即便抱之，而勅令坐。
translation: When the prince arrived, he bowed with his head and face, and his father took him in his arms and commanded him to sit down.

source_sentence: 太子坐已，白父王言：『恩愛集會，必有別離，唯願聽我出家學道。
translation: After he sat down, the prince said to his father, 'The gathering of kindnesses and loves will surely lead to separation, so please let me leave home and train on the path.

source_sentence: 一切眾生，愛別離苦，皆使解脫。
translation: All sentient beings who suffer from separation from what they love will be freed from it.

source_sentence: 願必垂許，不見留難。』
translation: May it be granted, and I won't see the difficulty of staying here.'

source_sentence: 時白淨王聞太子語，心大苦痛；猶如金剛摧破於山，舉身戰掉，不安本座，執太子手，不復能言，啼泣流淚，噓唏哽咽。
translation: When King Baekjeong heard what the prince said, his heart was so distressed that it was like when Vajra breaks down a mountain, he threw himself up in a fight, fell off his seat, took the prince's hand, couldn't speak, wept, and choked back tears.

source_sentence: 如是良久，微聲而言：『汝今宜應息出家意。
translation: After a long time like that, he said in a whisper, 'Now, you should stop thinking about leaving home.'

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 年既少壯，國未有嗣，而便委我，曾不迴顧。』
translation: He was so young and strong, and the country had no heir, that he entrusted me with his duties and never looked back.'

source_sentence: 爾時太子既見父王流淚不許，還歸所止，思惟出家，愁憂不樂。
translation: After seeing his father's disapproval with tears, the prince returned to his lodging, contemplated leaving home, and became sad and unhappy.

source_sentence: 「爾時迦毘羅斾兜國，諸大相師，占知太子，若不出家，過七日後，得轉輪王位，王四天下，七寶自至。
translation: "It was then that the great fortune tellers in Kapilavastu knew that if the prince didn't leave home, after seven days he would attain the position of wheel-turning king and the king's four worlds would be supplied with seven treasures.

source_sentence: 各以所知，往白王言：『釋迦種姓，於此方興。』
translation: Each of them said to the king, based on their knowledge, 'This is where the Śākya lineage comes into being.'

source_sentence: 王聞是語，心生歡喜，即勅諸臣并釋種子：『汝聞相師如此言不？
translation: When the king heard this, his heart rejoiced, and he commanded his ministers and the Śākya seed to say, 'Have you heard this from your fortune teller?'

source_sentence: 皆應日夜侍衛太子，於城四門，門各千人；周匝城外，一踰闍那內，邏置人眾，而防護之。』
translation: They should guard the prince day and night, with a thousand men at each of the city's four gates; they should patrol the city's outskirts and guard the people within one yojana.'

source_sentence: 復勅耶輸陀羅并諸內官，倍加警戒，過於七日，勿使出家。
translation: I also commanded Yehudhara and the inner officials to exercise extra vigilance and not to allow him to leave home for more than seven days.

source_sentence: 時王又來至太子所，太子遙見，即往奉迎，頭面禮足，問訊起居。
translation: When the king again came to the prince, he saw him from a distance, went to greet him, paid homage with his head and feet, and asked about his upbringing and residence.

source_sentence: 王語太子：『我昔既聞阿私陀說，及眾相師，并諸奇瑞，必定知汝不樂處世。
translation: The king said to the prince, 'Since I've heard Ashita speak in the past, along with the many form masters and wondrous appearances, I'm sure I know you don't enjoy the world.

source_sentence: 國嗣既重，屬當相繼，唯願為我，生汝一子，然後絕俗，不復相違。』
translation: Since the kingdom's heirs are heavy and the dependents will continue, only give birth to one of your sons for me, and then I will cut off conventionality and not contradict you again.'

source_sentence: 爾時太子，聞父王言，心自思惟：『大王所以苦留我者，正自為國無紹嗣耳。』
translation: It was then that the prince heard what his father said and thought to himself, 'The reason the king is so desperate to keep me here is because he thinks his country has no heir.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，而答王言：『善哉！
translation: After he thought this, he answered the king, 'Good!

source_sentence: 如勅。』
translation: As I've told you.'

source_sentence: 即以左手，指其妃腹，時耶輸陀羅，便覺體異，自知有娠。
translation: He then pointed his left hand at his wife's belly, and Yaśodharā felt a difference in her body and knew she was pregnant.

source_sentence: 王聞太子如勅之言，心大歡喜，當謂太子七日之內，必未有兒，若過此期，轉輪王位，自然而至，不復出家。
translation: When the king heard that the crown prince had told him as I had promised, his heart rejoiced greatly, saying that the crown prince would surely have no child within seven days, and that if that time passed, the position of wheel-turning king would come naturally, and he would no longer have to leave home.

source_sentence: 「爾時太子心自念言：『我年已至一十有九，今是二月，復是七日，宜應方便，思求出家。
translation: "At the time, the prince thought to himself, 'I've reached the age of 10 or 19, and now it's the second month and another seven days, so it's appropriate to think about leaving home.'

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 今正是時，又於父王，所願已滿。』
translation: 'Now is the right time, and at my father's place, I've fulfilled my vow.'

source_sentence: 作此念已，身放光明，照四天王宮，乃至照於淨居天宮，不令人間見此光明。
translation: After that thought, he radiated a bright light from his body that shone in the palaces of the four heavenly kings and even in the palace of the Pure Land gods, so that no one could see that light from here.

source_sentence: 爾時諸天見此光已，皆知太子出家時至；即便來下，到太子所，頭面禮足，合掌白言：『無量劫來，所修行願，今者正是成熟之時。』
translation: When the gods saw this light, they all knew that the prince had left home and had risen up. They then descended to the prince, bowed their heads and feet, put their palms together, and said, 'Now is the right time to mature the vows that I've cultivated for countless eons.'

source_sentence: 於是太子，答諸天言：『如汝等語，今正是時；然父王勅內外官屬，嚴見防衛，欲去無從。』
translation: The prince then answered the gods, 'As you say, now is the right time; however, the king has ordered his internal and external officials to guard him closely, and there's no way to get rid of him if I want to.'

source_sentence: 諸天白言：『我等自當設諸方便，令太子出，使無知者。』
translation: The gods said, 'We ourselves will find ways to get the prince out so that no one will know about it.'

source_sentence: 諸天即便以其神力，令諸官屬，皆悉惛臥。
translation: Even then, the gods used their supernormal powers to cause the officials to lie down.

source_sentence: 「爾時耶輸陀羅，眠臥之中，得三大夢：一者、夢月墮地；二者、夢牙齒落；三者、夢失右臂。
translation: "At the time, Yehudra was asleep and lying down when he had three major dreams: first, a dream about the moon falling to the ground; second, a dream about his teeth falling out; and third, a dream about losing his right arm.

source_sentence: 得此夢已，眠中驚覺，心大怖懼。
translation: After he had this dream, he was startled in his sleep and became very frightened.

source_sentence: 白太子言：『我於眠中，得三惡夢。』
translation: He said to the prince, 'I had three bad dreams while I was sleeping.'

source_sentence: 太子問言：『汝夢何等？』
translation: The prince asked, 'What was your dream?'

source_sentence: 耶輸陀羅，即便具說所夢之事。
translation: Even then, Yaśodharā explained exactly what he had dreamed.

source_sentence: 太子語言：『月猶在天，齒又不落，臂復尚在，當知諸夢虛假非實，汝今不應橫生怖畏。』
translation: The prince said, 'The moon is still in the sky, the teeth haven't fallen, and the arms are still there, so you should know that the dreams were false and not real; you shouldn't be frightened now.'

source_sentence: 耶輸陀羅，又語太子：『如我自忖所夢之事，必是太子出家之瑞。』
translation: Yaśodharā also said to the prince, 'Such things as I think I've dreamt must be a sign that the prince has left home.'

source_sentence: 太子又答：『汝但安眠勿生此慮，要不令汝有不祥事。』
translation: The prince also replied, 'Just sleep soundly and don't give rise to this concern, for it won't cause you to have bad fortune.'

source_sentence: 耶輸陀羅聞此語已，即便還眠。
translation: After hearing these words, Yaśodharā went back to sleep.

source_sentence: 太子即從坐起，遍觀妓女及耶輸陀羅，皆如木人，譬若芭蕉中無堅實；或有倚伏於樂器上，臂脚垂地，更相枕臥，鼻涕目淚，口中流涎。
translation: The prince then rose from his seat and looked around at the prostitute and Yaśodharā, who were all like wooden figures like plantains with no solidity in them; some of them were leaning over a musical instrument, their arms and legs were hanging to the ground, and they were lying on their backs, with tears streaming from their noses and eyes and saliva flowing from their mouths.

source_sentence: 又復遍觀妻及妓女，見其形體，髮爪髓腦，骨齒髑髏，皮膚肌肉，筋脉肪血，心肺脾腎，肝膽腸胃，屎尿涕唾，外為革囊，中盛臭穢，無一可奇；強熏以香，飾以花綵，譬如假借當還；亦不得久，百年之命，臥消其半，又多憂惱，其樂無幾。
translation: They also look at their wives and prostitutes and see their bodies, including their hair, nails, marrow, brains, bones, teeth, skulls, muscles, tendons, fat, blood, heart, lungs, spleen, kidneys, liver, gallbladder, intestines, stomach, feces, urine, tears, and spittle, which are made of leather on the outside and contain a foul-smelling substance inside, none of which are surprising; they are strongly perfumed and decorated with flowers and jewelry, like a pretend loan that's about to be returned; they don't last long, and half of their 100-year life is lost while lying down; they are often sad and troubled, and their pleasures are few.

source_sentence: 世人云何恒見此事，而不覺悟，又於其中，貪著婬欲？
translation: Why do people in the world always see this and don't realize it, and in it, they cling to lust?

source_sentence: 我今當學古昔諸佛所修之行，急應遠此大火之聚。
translation: Now, I will follow the example of the practices of the buddhas of yore, and I should urgently avoid this great fiery mass.

source_sentence: 「爾時太子，思惟是已；至於後夜，淨居天王，及欲界諸天，充滿虛空，即共同聲，白太子言：『內外眷屬，皆悉惽臥，今者正是出家之時。』
translation: "After he had thought about this, the prince considered it, and at the end of the night, the king of the Pure Land gods and the gods of the desire realm filled the sky with a common voice and said to the prince, 'All of my inner and outer retinue are lying down, and now is the time to leave home.'

source_sentence: 爾時太子，即便自往至車匿所；以天力故，車匿自覺，而語之言：『汝可為我被揵陟來。』
translation: The prince then even went himself to Chandaka, and because of the gods' power, Chandaka himself realized it and said, 'You can be gandharva for me.'

source_sentence: 爾時車匿，聞此言已，舉身戰怖，心懷猶豫；一者、不欲違太子命；二者、畏王勅旨嚴峻。
translation: After hearing those words, Chasenajit raised his body in fear and agitation, for one thing, he didn't want to disobey the prince's order; for another, he was afraid of the severity of the king's commands.

source_sentence: 思惟良久，流淚而言：『大王慈勅，如是之嚴；且又今者非遊觀時，又非降伏怨敵之日，云何於此後夜之中，而忽索馬，欲何所之？』
translation: After thinking about it for a long time, he said with tears in his eyes, 'The king's commands are so strict; besides, this is not a time for sightseeing or a day for subduing enemies, so why did he suddenly ask for a horse in the middle of the night?'

source_sentence: 太子又復語車匿言：『我今欲為一切眾生，降伏煩惱結使賊故。
translation: The prince also told Chandaka, 'Now, I want to subdue the afflictive bonds that make people thieves for all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 汝今不應違我此意。』
translation: You mustn't disobey me now.'

source_sentence: 爾時車匿，舉聲號泣，欲令耶輸陀羅及諸眷屬，皆悉覺知，太子當去。
translation: It was then that Chasenajit raised his voice and wept, wanting to make sure that Yaśodhar and his retinue all knew that the prince was leaving.

source_sentence: 以天神力，惛臥如故。
translation: By the power of the gods, they remained motionless as before.

source_sentence: 車匿即便牽馬而來；太子徐前，而語車匿及以揵陟：『一切恩愛，會當別離；世間之事，易可果遂，出家因緣，甚難成就。』
translation: Even as he pulled his horse along, Chandaka approached him, and the prince said to Chandaka and Śākyamuni, 'All these kindnesses and loves will be parted; worldly affairs are easy to accomplish, but the causes and conditions for leaving home are difficult to fulfill.'

source_sentence: 車匿聞已，默然無言。
translation: After he heard this, Chandaka remained silent.

source_sentence: 於是揵陟，不復噴鳴。
translation: Gandhāra then stopped blurting out.

source_sentence: 「爾時太子，見明相出，放身光明，徹照十方，師子吼言：『過去諸佛，出家之法，我今亦然。』
translation: "It was then that the prince saw a bright image emerge, and he radiated his body in a bright light that thoroughly illuminated the ten directions, and the lion roared, saying, 'The way the buddhas of the past left home, I will do the same now.'

source_sentence: 於是諸天，捧馬四足，并接車匿；釋提桓因，執蓋隨從，諸天即便令城北門，自然而開，不使有聲；太子於是從門而出，虛空諸天讚歎隨從。
translation: Thereupon, the gods took a horse with four legs and picked up the chariot, and Śakrodevānī followed with his lid. Even then, the gods caused the northern gate of the city to open naturally without making a sound; the prince then emerged from the gate, and the gods of the sky praised and followed him.

source_sentence: 爾時太子，又師子吼：『我若不斷生老病死憂悲苦惱，終不還宮；我若不得阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，又復不能轉於法輪，要不還與父王相見；若當不盡恩愛之情，終不還見摩訶波闍波提及耶輸陀羅。』
translation: At the time, the prince also shouted, 'If I didn't stop feeling sadness, sorrow, pain, and vexation about birth, age, sickness, and death, I would never return to the palace; if I didn't attain supreme perfect enlightenment and couldn't turn the wheel of the Dharma, I wouldn't return to see my father; and if I didn't end my feelings of kindness and love, I would never return to see Mahāprajāpatī Yaśodharā.'

source_sentence: 當於太子說此誓時，虛空諸天讚言：『善哉！
translation: When the prince said this vow, the sky gods praised him, saying, 'Good!

source_sentence: 斯言必果。』
translation: This claim will surely come true.'

source_sentence: 至于天曉，所行道路，已三踰闍那。
translation: At dawn, the path he traveled had already passed three times beyond the Ajñāta Heaven.

source_sentence: 時諸天眾，既從太子，至此處已，所為事畢，忽然不現。
translation: After they had followed the prince to this place, the host of gods suddenly disappeared when they had finished what they had been doing.

source_sentence: 「爾時太子，次行至彼跋伽仙人苦行林中。
translation: "The crown prince then traveled next to that grove of ascetic practices of the Bhārgava sage.

source_sentence: 太子見此園林，寂靜無諸諠鬧，心生歡喜，諸根悅豫。
translation: Seeing this quiet, uninhibited forest, the prince was delighted and his faculties were pleased.

source_sentence: 即便下馬，撫背而言：『所難為事，汝作已畢。』
translation: He then dismounted from his horse, rubbed his back, and said, 'You've done the difficult task.'

source_sentence: 又語車匿：『馬行駿疾，如金翅鳥王，汝恒隨從，不離我側；世間之人，或有善心，而形不隨，或運形力，而心不稱；汝今心形皆悉無違。
translation: He also said to Chasenajit, 'A fast-moving horse is like the garuḍa king, and you've always followed it, not leaving my side; there are people in the world who have good intentions but whose forms don't follow them, or who exert physical strength but whose minds don't match them; now, your mind and form are all without disagreement.

source_sentence: 又世間人，處富貴者，競隨奉事；我既捨國，來此林中，唯汝一人，獨能隨我，甚為希有。
translation: Also, there are people in the world who are rich and powerful and compete to serve them; since I left my country and came to this forest, you alone are the only one who can follow me, which is rare.

source_sentence: 我今既已至閑靜處，汝便可與揵陟俱還宮也。』
translation: Now that I've arrived at a quiet place, you can return to the palace with Gandhāra.'

source_sentence: 爾時車匿，聞此語已，悲號啼泣，迷悶躃地，不能自勝；於是揵陟，既聞被遣，屈膝舐足，淚落如雨。
translation: After hearing these words, Chandaka wailed and lamented, fell to the ground in confusion, and couldn't bring himself to stand up; then Gandhāra, hearing that he had been sent away, bent his knees and licked his feet, and his tears fell like rain.

source_sentence: 車匿答言：『我今云何忍聽太子如此言耶？
translation: Chandaka answered, 'How could I bear to listen to such words from the prince now?'

source_sentence: 我於宮中，違大王勅，輙被揵陟，以與太子，致令今日來至於此。
translation: In the palace, I disobeyed the king's order and improperly had my head gently chopped off and given to the prince, which led to my arrival here today.

source_sentence: 父王及摩訶波闍波提，失太子故，必當憂惱；宮中內外，亦應搔動。
translation: My father and Mahāprajāpatī will be sad and troubled because they lost the prince, and they will be troubled inside and outside the palace.

source_sentence: 又復此處，多諸嶮難，猛獸毒蟲，交橫道路，我今云何而捨太子，獨還宮耶？』
translation: Furthermore, this place is beset with many difficulties, and the roads are crisscrossed by fierce animals and venomous insects.

source_sentence: 太子即便答車匿言：『世間之法，獨生獨死，豈復有伴；又有生老病死諸苦，我當云何與此作侶？
translation: Even then, the prince answered Chandaka, 'How could there be companions in a world where dharmas are born alone and die alone, and where are the pains of birth, old age, illness, and death?

source_sentence: 吾今為欲斷諸苦故，而來至此。
translation: Now, I've come here because I want to end suffering.

source_sentence: 苦若斷時，然後當與一切眾生，而作伴侶。
translation: When suffering is stopped, then I'll be a companion to all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 我於即時，諸苦未離，云何而得為汝作侶？』
translation: At the time, I hadn't yet parted with my sufferings, so how could I be your companion?'

source_sentence: 車匿又曰：『太子生來，長於深宮，身體手足，皆悉柔軟，眠臥床褥，無不細滑；如何一旦履藉荊棘瓦礫泥土，止宿樹下。』
translation: Then Chandaka said, 'The prince was born and raised in a deep palace, where his body and hands and feet were all supple and soft, and his sleeping mat was always fine and smooth; how could he once have gotten bogged down by thorns, thorns, debris, and dirt and stayed under a tree?'

source_sentence: 太子答言：『誠如汝語，設我住宮，乃可免此荊蕀之患；老病死苦，會自見侵。』
translation: The prince answered, 'Is it true what you said, that if I were to stay at the palace, I would be spared the trouble of thorns and thorns, and I would see the pain of old age, illness, and death coming upon me?'

source_sentence: 車匿既聞太子此語，悲泣垂淚，默然而住。
translation: Hearing these words from the prince, Chandaka wept and sobbed as he quietly stayed there.

source_sentence: 「于時太子，即就車匿，取七寶劍，而師子吼：『過去諸佛，為成就阿耨多羅三藐三菩提故，捨棄飾好，剃除鬚髮；我今亦當依諸佛法。』
translation: "The prince then went to Chandaka, took the seven-jeweled sword, and Shizi roared, 'Those buddhas of the past renounced their adornments and shaved off their hair in order to achieve supreme perfect enlightenment; now I will also follow the teachings of those buddhas.'

source_sentence: 作此言已，便脫寶冠髻中明珠，以與車匿，而語之曰：『以此寶冠及以明珠，致王足下，汝可為我上白大王：「我今不為生天樂故，亦復非不孝順父母，亦無忿恨瞋恚之心，但以畏彼生老病死，為除斷故，來至此耳。
translation: After he said this, he took off the jeweled crown and the pearl in the topknot, gave it to Chandaka, and said, 'With this jeweled crown and pearl at the king's feet, you can tell the great king for me, 'Now, I didn't come here for the joy of being born in heaven, nor am I ungrateful to my parents, nor do I harbor anger or resentment, but I came here out of fear of birth, old age, illness, and death and to remove them.

source_sentence: 汝應助我隨喜欣慶，勿於吉祥更生悲愁。」
translation: Help me to rejoice and be glad, and don't become sad and resentful when it's fortunate."

source_sentence: 父王若謂我今出家未是時者，汝以我語，上啟大王：「老病死至，豈有定時，人雖少壯，焉得免此。」
translation: If my father says that this is not the right time for me to leave home, then you should use my words to tell the king, "Is there a set time when old age, illness, and death will come? How could a person, even though young and strong, be spared that?"

source_sentence: 父王若復而責我言：「本要有子，當聽出家，今未有子，云何而去？
translation: Again, suppose my father had rebuked me, saying, "If I had a son, I would have been allowed to leave home, but now that I don't have a son, how could I leave?

source_sentence: 及出宮時，不啟聞者。」
translation: When they leave the palace, they don't reveal what they've heard."

source_sentence: 汝可為我具啟父王：「耶輸陀羅，久已有身，王自問之。
translation: You can fully inform my father, the king, "Yaśodharā, the king has long had a body, and he asked about it himself.

source_sentence: 昔勅如此，非為專輙。
translation: I've told you in the past that this isn't a case of exclusive predilection.

source_sentence: 往古有諸轉輪聖王厭國位者，入於山林，出家求道，無有中途還受五欲；我今出家，亦復如是，未成菩提，終不還宮。」
translation: In the past, there were wheel-turning sage kings who became disillusioned with the position of their kingdom, went into the mountains and forests, left home to pursue the path, and never returned to the five desires halfway through their lives; now, having left home, I'm likewise, and I'll never return to the palace until I achieve enlightenment."

source_sentence: 內外眷屬，皆當於我有恩愛情，可以汝辯為解釋之，勿使於我橫生憂惱。』
translation: Both internal and external retinues must have kind and loving relationships with me, so you may explain them eloquently and not cause me to be disheartened.'

source_sentence: 「太子又復脫身瓔珞，以授車匿，而語之言：『汝可為我持此瓔珞，奉摩訶波闍波提道，我今為斷諸苦本故出宮城，求滿此願，勿復於我反更生苦。』
translation: "The prince then took off his necklace and gave it to Chandaka, saying, 'Carry this necklace for me as you dedicate it to the path of Mahāprajāpatī; now, I've left the palace to fulfill this vow in order to end the causes of suffering; don't let me bring suffering back again.'

source_sentence: 又脫身上餘莊嚴具，以與耶輸陀羅，亦復語言：『人生於世，愛別離苦；我今為欲斷此諸苦，出家學道；勿以我故恒生愁憂，并諸親屬，皆亦如是。』
translation: He also took off the rest of his ornaments and gave them to Yaśodharā, who also said, 'In this world, life is filled with the pain of separation from what's loved; now, in order to end these sufferings, I've left home and trained on the path; don't let constant sorrow arise because of me, and so will my relatives.'

source_sentence: 爾時車匿聞此語已，倍增悲絕；不忍違於太子勅令，即便長跪，受取寶冠明珠瓔珞及嚴飾具，垂淚而言：『我聞太子如此志願，舉身戰掉；設令有人心如木石，聞此語者，亦當悲感；況我生來奉侍太子，聞此誓言，而不感絕。
translation: After hearing these words, Chandaka became even more desperate; he couldn't bear to disobey the prince's order, so he knelt down long enough to accept the jeweled crown, bright pearls, jewelry, and ornaments, and said with tears in his eyes, 'I heard the prince's vow, and I threw myself into battle; even if someone with a heart of wood and stone heard those words, they would still be saddened and moved; how could I have been born to serve the prince and not be moved by hearing that vow?

source_sentence: 唯願太子，捨於此志，勿令父王，及摩訶波闍波提，耶輸陀羅，并餘親屬，生大悲苦。
translation: Please let the prince abandon this intention and not cause his father, Mahāprajāpatī, Yaśodharā, or any of their relatives to experience great sorrow and suffering.

source_sentence: 若使決定不迴此意，勿於是處，而復棄我；我今歸依太子足下，終不見有違離去理；設當還宮，王必責我，云何獨委太子而歸，欲令何言上答大王？』
translation: If he's determined not to change his mind, don't abandon me here; now that I've retired to the prince's feet, I don't see any reason to leave; when I return to the palace, the king will surely rebuke me, but why did he entrust the prince alone with his return, and what words would he have wanted to say to the king?'

source_sentence: 太子答言：『汝今不應作如此語，世皆離別，豈常集聚；我生七日，而母命終，母子尚有死生之別，而況餘人；汝勿於我偏生戀慕，可與揵陟俱還宮也。』
translation: The prince answered, 'You shouldn't say such a thing now; how could there be a permanent congregation when the world is separated? I was born seven days ago, and my mother's life ended; a mother and son are still separated by death and birth, so why wouldn't the rest of us? Don't get attached to me; you can return to the palace with Gandhāra.'

source_sentence: 如是再勅，猶不肯去。
translation: He repeatedly ordered him to do so, but he still refused to leave.

source_sentence: ◎◎「爾時太子，便以利劍，自剃鬚髮。
translation: The prince then shaved his own hair with a sharp sword.

source_sentence: 即發願言：『今落鬚髮，願與一切，斷除煩惱及以習障。』
translation: He then made a vow, saying, 'Now that I've shaved my hair, I want to give it to all of them, so I can end the afflictions and the hindrances of habituation.'

source_sentence: 釋提桓因，接髮而去。
translation: Śakrodevānām Indra took his hair and left.

source_sentence: 虛空諸天，燒香散花，異口同音讚言：『善哉！
translation: The gods of the sky burned incense and scattered flowers, praising him with one voice, 'Good!'

source_sentence: 善哉！』
translation: excellent!'

source_sentence: 爾時太子，剃鬚髮已，自見其身所著之衣，猶是七寶，即心念言：『過去諸佛出家之法，所著衣服，不當如此。』
translation: After shaving his hair, the prince saw for himself that the clothes he was wearing were just like the seven treasures, and he thought to himself, 'In the past, when the buddhas left home, the clothes they wore were not like this.'

source_sentence: 時淨居天，於太子前，化作獵師，身被袈裟。
translation: The Pure Land god then transformed himself into a hunter before the prince and covered himself with a reddish-brown robe.

source_sentence: 太子既見，心大歡喜，而語之言：『汝所著衣，是寂靜服，往昔諸佛之所幖幟也；云何著此，而為罪行？』
translation: When he saw this, the prince was greatly pleased, and he said, 'The robe you're wearing is a robe of tranquility, which was the corrugated board of directors of the buddhas of the past; why are you wearing this and committing a sin?'

source_sentence: 獵者答言：『我著袈裟，以誘群鹿，鹿見袈裟，皆來近我，我得殺之。』
translation: The hunter answered, 'I put on the robe to entice the deer, and when the deer see the robe, they all come near me, and I'm able to kill them.'

source_sentence: 太子又言：『若如汝說，著此袈裟，但欲為殺諸鹿故耳，非求解脫而服之也。
translation: The prince also said, 'If it's true what you say, I'm wearing this robe only because I want to kill the deer, not because I want to be liberated.

source_sentence: 我今持此七寶之衣，與汝貿易，吾服此衣，為欲攝救一切眾生，斷其煩惱。』
translation: Now, I'll trade this robe of seven treasures with you; I wore it to save all sentient beings and end their afflictions.'

source_sentence: 獵者答言：『善哉！
translation: The hunter replied, 'Good!

source_sentence: 如告。』
translation: As I've told you.'

source_sentence: 即脫寶衣，而與獵者；自被袈裟，依過去諸佛所服之法。
translation: He then took off his precious robe, gave it to the hunter, and covered himself with the reddish-brown robes according to the way the buddhas had dressed in the past.

source_sentence: 時淨居天，還復梵身，上升虛空，歸其所止。
translation: The Pure Land gods then returned to their brahma bodies, rose into the sky, and returned to their lodging.

source_sentence: 「于時空中，有異光明；車匿見此，心生奇特，歎未曾有：『今此瑞應，非為小緣。』
translation: "At the time, there was a strange light in the sky, and when Chandaka saw it, his mind was puzzled, and he praised it as unprecedented, 'Now, this auspicious response is not for trivial reasons.'

source_sentence: 車匿既見太子剃除鬚髮身著法服，定知太子必不可迴；悶絕於地，倍增懊惱。
translation: When he saw the prince with his hair shaved off and dressed in the Dharma robe, Chandaka knew for certain that the prince would never return; he fell to the ground in despair and became even more distressed.

source_sentence: 爾時太子，而語之言：『汝今宜應捨此悲愁，便還宮城，具宣我意。』
translation: The prince then said to him, 'Now, you should abandon this sadness and return to the palace and explain my intentions.'

source_sentence: 太子於是，即徐前行；車匿歔欷，頭面作禮，乃至遠望不見太子，然後方起；舉體戰掉，不能自勝，顧看揵陟及莊嚴具，嗚咽悲哽，涕泗交流；即牽揵陟，執持寶冠嚴身之具，車匿號咷，揵陟悲鳴，緣路而歸。
translation: The prince then proceeded slowly, and the charioteer lamented, paid homage with his head and face, and looked away when he didn't see the prince before rising; he held up his body in battle, unable to overcome it, looked at the gandharva and his ornaments, sobbed and grieved, and exchanged tears; he then took the gandharva and carried the jeweled crown and ornaments, and the charioteer trumpeted and the gandharva cried out in pity as he made his way back.

source_sentence: 「爾時太子，即便前至跋伽仙人所住之處。
translation: "The prince then went straight ahead to where the Bhārgava sage was staying.

source_sentence: 時彼林中，有諸鳥獸，既見太子，皆悉矚目，端住不瞬。
translation: When the birds and animals in that forest saw the prince, they all looked at him intently and didn't look away.

source_sentence: 跋伽仙人，遙見太子，而自念言：『此是何神，為日月天？
translation: The Bhagavān looked at the prince from a distance and thought to himself, 'What god is this, the sun and moon god?'

source_sentence: 為帝釋耶？』
translation: Is it Tissa?'

source_sentence: 便與眷屬來迎太子，深生敬重，而作是言：『善來！
translation: He then came with his retinue to greet the prince, paid deep respect, and said, 'Good, come!'

source_sentence: 仁者。』
translation: 'Sir,' said the prince.

source_sentence: 太子既見諸仙人眾，心意柔軟，威儀庠序，太子即便前其住處，諸仙人等，無復威光，皆悉同來請太子坐；太子坐已，觀察彼諸仙人之行，或有以草而為衣者，或以樹皮樹葉以為服者，或有唯食草木花果，或有一日一食，或二日一食，或三日一食，如是行於自餓之法。
translation: When the prince saw the crowd of sages, their minds were gentle, and their manners were peaceful, he went to their lodging and was invited by the sages, who were no longer dignified, to sit with him. After he sat down, the prince observed the behavior of those sages, whether they were clothed with grass, dressed with bark and leaves, eating only grass, trees, flowers, and fruits, or eating once a day, once every two days, or once every three days, or thus practicing the law of self-hunger.

source_sentence: 或事水火，或奉日月，或翹一脚，或臥塵土，或有臥於荊蕀之上，或有臥於水火之側。
translation: Some work with water and fire, some worship the sun and moon, some cross their legs, some lie on the dust, some lie on top of thorns and briers, and some lie beside water and fire.

source_sentence: 太子既見如此苦行，即便問於跋伽仙人：『汝等今者修此苦行，甚為奇特，皆欲求於何等果報？』
translation: Seeing such austerities, the prince even asked the Bhārgava sages, 'Is this austerity you're practicing now so extraordinary that you want to seek what kind of reward?'

source_sentence: 仙人答言：『修此苦行，為欲生天。』
translation: The sage answered, 'I cultivate this ascetic practice in order to be born in the heavens.'

source_sentence: 太子又問：『諸天雖樂，福盡則窮，輪迴六道，終為苦聚。
translation: The prince also asked, 'Although the gods are blessed, their fortune is exhausted, and their transmigration through the six destinies ends in a mass of suffering.

source_sentence: 汝等云何修諸苦因，以求苦報。』
translation: How do you cultivate these causes of suffering in order to seek the results of suffering?'

source_sentence: 太子即便心自歎言：『商人為寶，故入大海；王為國土，興師相伐；今諸仙人，為生天故，修此苦行。』
translation: Even then, the prince praised himself, saying, 'Merchants enter the ocean because of their treasures; kings raise armies to fight each other for their lands; and sages now cultivate these painful practices in order to be born in the heavens.'

source_sentence: 作是歎已，默然而住。
translation: After he praised them, he waited silently.

source_sentence: 「跋伽仙人，即問太子：『仁者何意，默然不言，我等所行非真正耶？』
translation: "The Bhārgava sages then asked the prince, 'Sir, what do you mean by being silent and not saying that what we're doing isn't genuine?'

source_sentence: 太子答言：『汝等所行，非不至苦，然求果報，終不離苦。』
translation: The prince answered, 'It's not that what you do doesn't lead to suffering, but seeking its result will never lead to freedom from suffering.'

source_sentence: 太子與諸仙人，設此議論言語往復，乃至日暮。
translation: The prince and the sages held this discussion, talking back and forth until sundown.

source_sentence: 太子即便停彼一宿，既至明旦，復更思惟：『此諸仙人，雖修苦行，皆非解脫真正之道。』
translation: Even after he stopped there for the night, the prince again thought to himself by sunrise, 'Even though these sages are cultivating ascetic practices, they aren't the true path to liberation.'

source_sentence: 我今不應止住於此，即與仙人，辭別欲去。
translation: Now, I shouldn't have stopped here, so I said goodbye to the sages and wanted to leave.

source_sentence: 時諸仙人，白太子言：『仁者來此，我皆歡喜；令我人眾，威德增盛。
translation: The sages then said to the prince, 'We're all happy that you've come here, and it's made our people's authority grow.

source_sentence: 今者何故而忽欲去？
translation: Why is it that you suddenly want to leave?'

source_sentence: 為是我等，失於威儀？
translation: Why have we failed in our deportment?

source_sentence: 為此眾中相犯觸耶？
translation: Is it because of the transgressions among these people?

source_sentence: 以何因緣，不住於此？』
translation: By what causes and conditions does one not dwell here?'

source_sentence: 太子答言：『非是汝等有如是失，賓主之儀亦無所少，但汝所修，增長苦因；我今學道，為斷苦本，以此因緣，是故去耳。』
translation: The prince answered, 'It's not that you have made such a mistake, nor is there anything missing from the manner of the guest and host, but your practice has increased the cause of suffering; now I'm training in the Way to end the root of suffering, and for this reason, I'm leaving.'

source_sentence: 諸仙人眾，自共議言：『其所修道，極為廣大，云何我等而得留之？』
translation: The crowd of sages agreed among themselves, saying, 'Their path of cultivation is so vast, why do we get to stay here?'

source_sentence: 「爾時有一仙人，善知相法，語眾人言：『今此仁者，諸相具足，必當得於一切種智，為天人師。』
translation: "It was then that an immortal who well knew the teaching of appearances said to the crowd, 'Now, you, sir, are fully endowed with all kinds of characteristics; you will surely attain the knowledge of all kinds and become a teacher of gods and humans.'

source_sentence: 即便俱往詣太子所，而作是言：『所修道異，不敢相留；若欲去者，可向北行，彼有大仙，名阿羅邏、加蘭，仁者可往就其語論；我觀仁者，亦當不必住於彼處。』
translation: They all went to the prince and said, 'I dare not stay here because my path is different; if you want to leave, go north; there are great sages named Ararō and Kālāma there, and you may go and discuss their teachings; I observe that you, too, needn't stay there.'

source_sentence: 於是太子，即便北行。
translation: The prince then proceeded north.

source_sentence: 諸仙人眾，見太子去，心懷懊惱，合掌隨送，極望絕視，然後乃還。
translation: When the crowd of sages saw the prince depart, they were distressed and followed him with folded palms, gazing desperately, before returning.

source_sentence: 「爾時太子，既出宮已，至於天曉，耶輸陀羅，及諸婇女，從眠而覺；不見太子，悲號啼泣，即便往啟摩訶波闍波提：『今旦忽失太子所在。』
translation: "After the prince had left the palace, it was dawn when Yajodhar and the women awoke from their slumber without seeing the prince, lamenting and weeping, and they went to Mahāprajāpatī and asked, 'Now, we've suddenly lost track of where the prince is.'

source_sentence: 摩訶波闍波提聞是語已，迷悶躃地，如是展轉，乃至達王。
translation: After hearing these words, Mahāprajāpatī fell to the ground in a state of delusion and continued in this way until he reached the king.

source_sentence: 王聞此言，屹然無聲，失其精魄，若喪四體，舉宮內外，皆亦如是。
translation: When the king heard those words, he stood silent, lost his vitality, and looked as if he had lost four bodies, and so did the palace both inside and outside.

source_sentence: 時諸大臣，即入檢視太子住處，案行宮城，見城北門，自然已開，又復不見車匿揵陟。
translation: The ministers then went to examine the prince's quarters and examined the palace grounds, and they saw that the northern gate of the city had naturally been opened, and they hadn't seen Chandaka Gandhāra.

source_sentence: 即問門司：『誰開此者？』
translation: They then asked the gate keeper, 'Who opened this?'

source_sentence: 互相推撿，皆云不知；并問防人，亦云不解此門開意。
translation: They all told each other that they didn't know, and when they asked the guards, they also told them that they didn't understand the meaning of the opening of this gate.

source_sentence: 于時大臣，心自思惟：『北門既開，太子必當從此而出，宜速尋覓太子所在。』
translation: The minister then thought to himself, 'Now that the northern gate has been opened, the prince must have emerged from here; it's better to quickly find out where he is.'

source_sentence: 即勅千乘萬騎，絡繹四出，追求太子；以天力故，迷失道逕，不知所之。
translation: They then sent a thousand carts and ten thousand horses out in vain to pursue the prince, but because of the power of the gods, they lost their way and didn't know where he was.

source_sentence: 即便還歸，白大王言：『推尋太子，不知所在？』
translation: They even returned and said to the king, 'They searched for the crown prince, but they don't know where he is.'

source_sentence: 「爾時車匿，步牽揵陟，及莊嚴具，悲泣鳴咽，隨路而還。
translation: "It was then that Chasenajit took his gandharva and his ornaments, weeping and sobbing, and returned along the road.

source_sentence: 舉邑人民，見此驚愕，無不懊惱，悉皆競來，問車匿言：『汝送太子，置於何處？
translation: The people of the town were shocked and upset at the sight of this, and they all rushed over to Chandaka and asked, 'Where did you put the prince when you sent him away?'

source_sentence: 今與揵陟，而獨還耶？』
translation: How can you return alone with Gandhāra?'

source_sentence: 車匿既得諸人此問，倍更悲絕，不能答之。
translation: When he heard this question from the people, Chandaka was doubly distressed and couldn't answer it.

source_sentence: 此諸人民，雖見揵陟被帶鞍勒七寶莊嚴，不見太子，猶若死人飾以花綵。
translation: Although the people saw Gandhāra being adorned with seven treasures while wearing a saddle, they didn't see the prince, who looked like a dead man adorned with flowers and jewelry.

source_sentence: 於是車匿，前入宮城，揵陟悲嘶，諸廐群馬，一時哀鳴。
translation: The chariot then hid and entered the palace, and Gandhāra neighed sadly, while the stables and horses roared with lamentation.

source_sentence: 外諸官屬，白摩訶波闍波提及耶輸陀羅言：『車匿唯與揵陟俱還。』
translation: The outer officials said to Mahāprajāpatī-Yaśodharā, 'Only the charioteer and the gandharva will return together.'

source_sentence: 聞此言已，宛轉于地，而自念曰：『今者唯聞車匿揵陟相隨俱還，而不聞道太子歸聲。』
translation: After hearing those words, he turned to the ground and thought to himself, 'Now, I've only heard of Chandaka and Gandaka returning together, but I haven't heard the sound of the prince of the Way returning.'

source_sentence: 摩訶波闍波提即作是言：『我養太子，至年長大，一旦捨我，不知所在？
translation: Mahāprajāpatī then said, 'I raised the prince until he was old enough, but once he leaves me, I wonder where he is?'

source_sentence: 譬如果樹，結花成實，臨熟落地；又如飢人，遇百味饌，臨欲食之，忽然翻倒。』
